text:
!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! SORRY FOR HTTPD -V REPORT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
!!!!!!!!!!! IT IS DUE TO ANOTHER OLD BUILD INSTALLED ON THE SYSTEM!!!!!!!!!!!!

The correct one is:

Server version: Apache/2.1.3
Server built:   May 19 2005 13:09:00
Server's Module Magic Number: 20050217:0
Architecture:   32-bit
Server MPM:     Prefork
  threaded:     no
    forked:     yes (variable process count)
Server compiled with....
 -D APACHE_MPM_DIR="server/mpm/prefork"
 -D APR_HAS_SENDFILE
 -D APR_HAS_MMAP
 -D APR_HAVE_IPV6 (IPv4-mapped addresses enabled)
 -D APR_USE_SYSVSEM_SERIALIZE
 -D APR_USE_PTHREAD_SERIALIZE
 -D SINGLE_LISTEN_UNSERIALIZED_ACCEPT
 -D APR_HAS_OTHER_CHILD
 -D AP_HAVE_RELIABLE_PIPED_LOGS
 -D HTTPD_ROOT="/usr/local/apache-213B/"
 -D SUEXEC_BIN="/usr/local/apache-213B//bin/suexec"
 -D DEFAULT_PIDLOG="logs/httpd.pid"
 -D DEFAULT_SCOREBOARD="logs/apache_runtime_status"
 -D DEFAULT_LOCKFILE="logs/accept.lock"
 -D DEFAULT_ERRORLOG="logs/error_log"
 -D AP_TYPES_CONFIG_FILE="conf/mime.types"
 -D SERVER_CONFIG_FILE="conf/httpd.conf"

text: This is just a warning. Not a failure.

creator: alcol@hotmail.com
text:
ya, sorry if I reopen the bug but HTTPD don't start as daemon! Me too 
classified the message as it is but in the end I was unable to let HTTPD to be 
in memory as daemon.

See that I'm not so expert but I compile from time things and httpd (APACHE) 
too and from 1.3 ver. I never had problems to get it as daemon!. Have I wrong 
in conf files or other? This is my first time with APR and LDAP support.

If you are having these types of problems, use the user support list, not the
bug database:
http://httpd.apache.org/lists.html#http-users
creator: chip@force-elite.com
